step_1.project_idea: EduCora AI is a learning and development platform with 11 microservices. Skills Engine is the microservice that acts as the central authority for managing all skill and competency data within the platform. It maintains a hierarchical skill taxonomy, tracks user skill profiles, verifies skills, and enables precise gap analysis. Its core purpose is to provide accurate, structured skill data to other services, supporting personalized learning, career development, and talent management.
step_1.business_goals: The Skills Engine microservice establishes a single source of truth for skills and competencies across the EduCora AI platform, ensuring consistent, verified data for all training, assessments, and reporting. It enables accurate tracking of individual and team skill levels, allowing employees and trainers to identify gaps and take targeted development actions. By providing structured skill data to other services like Learner AI, Content Studio, and Course Builder, it supports competency-aligned content, courses, and learning paths, enhancing personalized learning experiences. For organizations, it delivers insights into workforce competencies, improves talent management, and ensures scalable, efficient, and data-driven decision-making for employee growth and upskilling initiatives.

employees.description: View their own skill profiles, track verified competencies, and identify skill gaps

trainers.description: Same as employees, plus can upload custom skills/competencies via CSV. Cannot manage the skill taxonomy (that's an admin function)

indirect_users.description: Users accessing Skills Engine data through other services (Directory, EduCore)
indirect_users.example: Employee viewing skills summary via Directory - data provided by Skills Engine but interface is through another service

microservices.name: Assessment
microservices.role: Sends exam results to update verified skills

microservices.name: Course Builder
microservices.role: Requests skills to map courses or training paths

microservices.name: Content Studio
microservices.role: Sends competency to Skills Engine and receives all related skills to generate/organize lesson content

microservices.name: Learner AI
microservices.role: Receives missing skills per user, queries Skills Engine for skills related to competency to build learning plans and recommend courses

microservices.name: RAG/Chatbot
microservices.role: Extracts skill and competency data for analytics or user queries

microservices.name: Directory
microservices.role: Retrieves skill and competency summaries for display in user dashboards

microservices.name: Learning Analytics
microservices.role: Retrieves stored, pre-calculated individual profiles and aggregate team competency status for reporting and insights

step_1.problem_statement: Before Skills Engine, skill and competency data across the platform was fragmented, unstructured, and often unreliable. There was no single source of truth for skills, making it difficult to track user proficiency, identify skill gaps, and provide personalized learning paths. Skills Engine solves this by centralizing all skill data, verifying user skills, maintaining a flexible hierarchical taxonomy, and enabling precise gap analysis for career development.

vision_mission.vision: To be the central, authoritative source of skills and competencies within the EduCora AI platform, enabling transparent, data-driven skill development for every employee and supporting organizations in achieving a highly skilled, future-ready workforce.
vision_mission.mission: The Skills Engine microservice organizes, verifies, and delivers structured skill and competency data, powering accurate skill tracking, gap analysis, and competency-aligned learning experiences. It ensures that all services within EduCora AI can rely on a consistent, authoritative source of skill information, enabling personalized growth, informed talent management, and measurable learning outcomes.

performance.api_response_times: Flexible - API response times appropriate for operation complexity (e.g., simple reads faster, complex gap analysis may take longer)

technical: Must integrate seamlessly with existing EduCora AI services
platform: Reliable operation within EduCora AI ecosystem
authentication: Each microservice integration requires its own authentication token
Microservices with tokens: Directory, Assessment, Content Studio, Course Builder, Learner AI, Learning Analytics, RAG/Chatbot
Skills Engine must manage and validate tokens for each microservice connection
